output: Print the stored number of each array position, in the form "N[i] = X", where i is the position of the array and x is the stored number at the position i. The first number for X is V.
input: The input contains an integer number  V (V < 50).
name: Array fill I
description: Read a number and make a program which puts this number in the first position of an array N[10]. In each subsequent position, put the double of the previous position. For example, if the input number is 1, the array numbers ​​must be 1,2,4,8, and so on.
